item.title: Trees under threat of new developments, 14th August
item.description:
Two trees, one in particular under threat as extension has been built and new landscaping is being carried out. Trees are home to nesting birds as well as providing remaining privacy for immediate neighbours. These trees are decades old and have been part of the landscape and home to wildlife. The trees are on the back of the property on 2 Cleevelands Avenue, Cheltenham, Gloucestershire. The development began at the beginning of 2023. Recently work has begun on the garden area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Cleevelands Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Nunney Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole Forming, 11th August
item.description:
A pothole is forming quickly on the M5 Southbound about 1/2 mile of Junction 10. There are others before it, but you can't miss this one as it's just on the driver side wheel and could be dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
